doc:
Anne Wiazemsky https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anne_Wiazemsky 0 Anne Wiazemsky (14 May 1947 - 5 October 2017) was a French actress and novelist. Through her mother, she was the granddaughter of novelist and dramatist François Mauriac. She made her cinema debut at the age of 18, playing Marie, the lead character in Robert Bresson's Au Hasard Balthazar (1966), and went on to appear in several of Jean-Luc Godard's films, among them La Chinoise (1967), Week End (1967), and One Plus One (1968). She and Godard were married from 1967 to 1979. Anne_Wiazemsky ( 14_May_1947 - 5_October_2017 ) was a_French_actress_and_novelist . Through her_mother , she was the_granddaughter of novelist_and_dramatist_François_Mauriac . She made her_cinema_debut at the_age of 18 , playing Marie , the_lead_character in Robert_Bresson 's_Au_Hasard_Balthazar_(_1966_) , and went on to_appear in several of Jean-Luc_Godard 's_films , among them La_Chinoise_(_1967_)_,_Week_End_(_1967_) , and One_Plus_One_(_1968_) . She and Godard were_married from 1967 to 1979 .
